attributes.action: Ask MPs to keep to their known wishes on the EU expressed at the last Election.
attributes.additional_details:
We consequently ask that Parliament does not advise leaving the EU, with no known execution plans, as this would be both irresponsible and acting undemocratically.
Please see:
1)	The verbatim report of the limited (by subject matter) debate of 05 September 2016 Hansard Volume 614 at https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2016-09-05/debates/1609058000001/EUReferendumRules#debate-134846
2)	Professor AC Grayling’s article at http://nowweknow.co.uk/why-parliament-has-a-duty-to-keep-us-in-the-eu/
attributes.background: At the last General Election over 3 out of 4 winning MPs wished to remain in the EU. Democratically elected MPs ought not abandon their known stance and overturn the UK electorate’s mandate because of a referendum where campaigns were dominated by immigration rather than the EU.
